title: Katie Price says Rebekah Vardy 'must be guilty' & backs Coleen Rooney
text:
Katie Price has firmly backed Coleen Rooney in the dramatic ‘WAGatha Christie’ scandal, claiming that Rebekah Vardy ‘must be guilty’.

The star, who recently showed off the results of her latest surgery, spoke out in her latest YouTube video.

After reading out Coleen’s dramatic statement, in which she accuses Rebekah of selling stories about her, Katie said: ‘I’m just saying, not that I’m taking sides, Coleen seems a bit like me. You don’t say stuff unless you have evidence.

‘Now, anyone I’ve outed for a reason if they really tried to damage me, for example my best friends when they betrayed me with the husband, course I’m gonna out them, name and shame them…why wouldn’t you?’

‘It’s horrible that Rebekah’s getting all this s***…but I believe, I genuinely believe, that Coleen would not put this statement out unless she had evidence,’ she added. ‘There must be truth in it. There’s got to be.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The star acknowledged that she also ‘looked at it the other way.’

‘Rebekah – what would Rebekah gain by doing this?’ she asked. ‘She doesn’t need the money, it’s not about the fame. She’s got a happy life.’

However, she insisted: ‘Knowing the situation I’ve been in…there’s got to be truth in it,’ and went on to claim: ‘My verdict is, Rebekah must be guilty. Coleen needs to back [her claims] up and show us.’

Katie wasn’t afraid to weigh in on the drama (Picture: YouTube/Katie Price)

Katie is just the latest celeb to wade into the drama, joining the likes of Danielle Lloyd, Vinnie Jones, and even Avengers star Paul Rudd.

It truly is international news at this point.

Sending the internet into meltdown, Wayne Rooney’s wife recently penned a statement which detailed how she had invented stories (for instance her house getting flooded) to see if they’d made their way to the press.

She then blocked everyone except for Rebekah’s account from seeing her Instagram Stories.

Jamie Vardy’s wife then denied all claims and hit back in her own statement.

‘As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this. I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me over the years can vouch for,’ she wrote.

‘If you thought this was happening you could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped. Over the years various people have had access to my Insta and just this week I found I was following people I didn’t know and have never followed myself.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The reality star continued: ‘I’m not being funny but I don’t need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you? I liked you a lot Coleen and I’m so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I’m heavily pregnant.

‘I’m disgusted that I’m even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened.’

Metro.co.uk has contacted reps for Rebekah for comment.

MORE: Vinnie Jones calls Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy an embarrassment to their husbands
description: Katie Price has said Rebekah Vardy 'must be guilty' and has backed Coleen Rooney in the 'WAGatha Christie' scandal.
